Prompter

class babydragon.chat.base_chat.Prompter[source]

This class handles the system and user prompts and the prompt_func. By subclassing and overriding the prompt_func, you can change the way the prompts are composed.

Parameters:

  • system_prompt (str) –

  • user_prompt (str) –

BaseChat

class babydragon.chat.base_chat.BaseChat[source]

This is the base class for chatbots, defining the basic functions that a chatbot should have, mainly the calls to chat-gpt API, and a basic Gradio interface. It has a prompt_func that acts as a placeholder for a call to chat-gpt API without any additional messages. It can be overridden by subclasses to add additional messages to the prompt.

Parameters:

  • model (str) –

  • max_output_tokens (int) –

identity_prompter(message)[source]

A simple identity prompter that takes a message and returns the message marked as a question.

Parameters:

message (str) – A string representing the user message.

Returns:

A tuple containing the marked question and the original message.

Return type:

Tuple[List[Dict], str]

query(message, verbose=True)[source]

Query the chatbot with a given message, optionally showing the input and output messages as Markdown.

Parameters:

  • message (str) – A string representing the user message.

  • verbose (bool) – A boolean indicating whether to display input and output messages as Markdown.

Returns:

A string representing the chatbot’s response.

Return type:

str

run_text(text, state)[source]

Process the user’s text input and update the chat state.

Parameters:

  • text (str) – A string representing the user input.

  • state (List[Tuple[str, str]]) – A list of tuples representing the current chat state.

Returns:

A tuple containing the updated chat state as two lists of tuples.

Return type:

Tuple[List[Tuple[str, str]], List[Tuple[str, str]]]
